items.question: How does the mental health screening test work?
items.answer: Our screening uses validated questionnaires to assess your mental well-being. You answer a series of questions about your thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. Based on your responses, we provide insights into potential areas of concern and recommend appropriate next steps.

items.question: Is this a clinical diagnosis?
items.answer: No, this screening is not a clinical diagnosis. It is a preliminary assessment tool designed to help you understand your mental health better. For a proper diagnosis, please consult a licensed mental health professional.

items.question: Are my results confidential and private?
items.answer: Yes, your privacy is our top priority. All data is encrypted and stored securely. We do not share your personal information with third parties without your explicit consent.

items.question: How much does it cost to take this mental health screening?
items.answer: The initial mental health screening is completely free. Some detailed assessments and additional features may require a subscription or one-time payment.

items.question: What is a mental health screening?
items.answer: A mental health screening is a quick assessment that helps identify signs of mental health conditions. It typically involves answering questions about your mood, thoughts, and behaviors over a recent period.

items.question: Who can take this mental health screening?
items.answer: Anyone aged 13 and above can take this screening. However, if you are under 18, we recommend involving a parent or guardian in reviewing your results.

items.question: What do I need to complete this mental health screening?
items.answer: You just need about 10-15 minutes of quiet time and honest reflection. There are no right or wrong answers - just answer based on how you have been feeling recently.

items.question: How long does it take to complete this initial mental health screening?
items.answer: The initial screening takes approximately 5-10 minutes. Detailed assessments for specific conditions may take an additional 5-10 minutes each.

items.question: I have thoughts of killing myself. Do I need to complete this mental health screening?
items.answer: If you are having thoughts of harming yourself, please seek immediate help. Call Talian Kasih at 15999 or Befrienders at 03-7956 8145. You can also go to the nearest hospital emergency department. Your life matters.

items.question: What happens after I complete this initial mental health screening?
items.answer: After completing the screening, you will receive preliminary insights about your mental well-being. Based on your results, we may recommend specific detailed assessments and provide resources for support.

items.question: Are the decisions made highly valid and reliable?
items.answer: Our screening tools are based on clinically validated instruments used worldwide, including PHQ-9 for depression and GAD-7 for anxiety. However, they are screening tools, not diagnostic instruments.
